data.event: Brewster was first settled in 1656 as a northeastern parish of the town of Harwich.

event.title: separated from Harwich as the northern, more wealthy parish in 1693

data.event: The town separated from Harwich as the northern, more wealthy parish in 1693, and was officially incorporated as its own town in 1803 when the less wealthy citizens of Harwich were upset that the town's institutions were all on Brewster's main street (now Route 6A), including the town hall and churches.

event.title: was officially incorporated as its own town in 1803

event.title: built many of the mansions and stately homes which now

data.event: There were many rich sea captains in the town, who built many of the mansions and stately homes which now constitute the town's inns and bed-and-breakfasts.
